title: Chris Keane
text:
Chris Keane (born 25 October 1978 in <a href="Drogheda">Drogheda</a>) is a former Irish <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. Keane began his provincial career with <a href="Connacht%20Rugby">Connacht</a> where he received 90 caps (65 Celtic/Magners League, 24 ERC Challenge Cup), the first coming against <a href="Cardiff%20Blues">Cardiff Blues</a> in a 6–3 victory. Keane made his Leinster debut on 5 October 2007 against <a href="Scarlets">Llanelli Scarlets</a> in a 23–52 <a href="Pro14">Celtic League</a> defeat. On 15 December he made his first <a href="Heineken%20Cup">Heineken Cup</a> appearance against <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh</a> at <a href="Murrayfield%20Stadium">Murrayfield</a>. Again it was a match that Leinster lost (29–10). He was released at the end of the 2010 season and subsequently retired from Rugby. Keane has been recognised by his country at sevens, colleges, and 'A' levels.
He is currently co-manager of <a href="Skerries%20Rugby%20Club">Skerries Rugby Club</a> with John Murphy.
